intro: Galium sidamense, commonly known as the sidamense bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides. Its slender stems are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, white or pale pink flowers in clusters. The leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
